title-group.article-title: Uniform Asymptotic Solution of Second Order Linear Differential Equations without Turning Varieties

abstract.p: The purpose of this paper is to initiate the study of a new kind of asymptotic series expansion for solutions of differential equations containing a parameter. We obtain uniform asymptotic solutions for certain equations of the form <tex-math>$\epsilon^{2n}y''= a(t, \epsilon)y,\quad(\quad)' = d/dt$</tex-math>, where n is a positive integer, t and ε are real variables ranging over <latex>$|t| \leqq t_0, 0 < \epsilon \leqq \epsilon_0$</latex>, and a is a function infinitely differentiable on the closure of this domain. We require that a(t, ε) satisfy conditions which can be regarded as generalized nonturning-point conditions. These conditions imply the absence of secondary turning points, and reduce in the simplest case to the condition a(t, 0) ≠ 0, but also include cases (the interesting ones) in which a(0, 0) = 0.
